result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Lisa M Maldonado in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Lillian V. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

***AMENDED 09-08-2015; REMOVE GPS, BUT STILL NO CONTACT WITH JM; JB; CR; AS.***Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***6-8-15 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO ALLOW DEFT TO GO TO WORK WHILE ON GPS MONITORING, DEFT MUST CONTACT ZCI PRIOR TO GOING TO WORK AND PROVIDE DOCUMENTATION***  ***5-28-2015 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO ALLOW THE DEFT TO LEAVE HER HOME FOR UP TO FOUR HOURS A DAY FOR THE PURPOSE OF SEARCHING FOR A JOB. THE DEFT SHALL NOTIFY ZCI WHEN SHE IS LEAVING HER HOME TO BEGIN HER JOB SEARCH.***Do not drive at all, exceptions to driving will be for purposes of employment.  No contact with the victim CMR (person, property, residence or family). No contact with the property of 3108 Debra Lane and 2727 Norwood Dr in the County of Racine, WI.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions to GPS monitoring is going to court, meeting with the atty and going to work.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
